column4: How can I X into another Ubuntu box from my main one, can somebody point the way?
yes, but I was hoping to use xcmdp (or whatever it's called)
i'm sorry but i've only used vnc and just logged in while another user is already logged, but i think you may look in to x11 forwarding
then I'll just keep on looking.  thank you.
do you want vncserver to run all the time on the server
actually, I think it's running - but i'm unable to connect to it.  I have turned off the firewall.
I'm getting "unable to connect to hose:  connection refused (111)"
how did you turn on vnc
I installed it with apt-get install vncserver
then I started it with vncserver
I get an error on start:  "xauth:  (argv):1: bad display name .. blah blah blah
I don't need some BS port forwarding on my side (client) to make this work, do I?
you dont need any firewall port forwarding if you are are the same network as the vnc server
